intro: Tabebuia schunkevigoi, commonly known as the pink tabebuia, is a flowering tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a dense canopy with glossy, dark green leaves. Its flowers bloom in the dry season, making it a valuable ornamental plant in tropical landscapes. The wood of Tabebuia schunkevigoi is also valued for its durability and is used in furniture and construction.
